Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. NaRon Tillman, St. Phillip’s Christian Church, 765 Lafayette Avenue, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11221.  

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Cornegy.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. NaRon Tillman, St. Phillip's Christian Church, 765 Lafayette Avenue, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11221.



Council Member Palma moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 8, 2014 be adopted as printed by Council Member Arroyo.
Items.MinutesNote: On behalf of Council Member Arroyo, Council Member Palma moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 8, 2014 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Chin:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 11 Avenue of the America (aka 11 Sixth Avenue), Borough of Manhattan, Community Board No. 1, Application No.  20145332 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 11 Avenue of the America (aka 11 Sixth Avenue), Manhattan (20145332 TCM)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass legislation permitting health care practitioners to provide treatment to youth for the prevention of human papillomavirus, a common virus that can cause cancer.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Permitting health care practitioners to provide treatment to youth for the prevention of human papillomavirus, a common virus that can cause cancer.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing January as Cervical Health Awareness Month in New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Recognizing January as Cervical Health Awareness Month in NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass, and the President to sign the James Zadroga 9/11 Health and Compensation Reauthorization Act.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: James Zadroga 9/11 Health and Compensation Reauthorization Act.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to geothermal systems
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Geothermal systems

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the posting of information related to services offered at licensed appearance enhancement businesses.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Requiring the posting of information related to services offered at licensed appearance enhancement businesses.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority not to raise subway and bus fares in 2015.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Calling upon the MTA not to raise subway and bus fares in 2015.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation amending the General Business Law to authorize the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to enforce State health and safety regulations against appearance enhancement establishments and to allow the Department to create a letter grading system for these establishments.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Amending the General Business Law to authorize the NYC DOHMH to enforce State health and safety regulations against appearance enhancement establishments and to allow the Dept to create a letter grading system for these establishments.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation amending the general business law to require periodic retraining of persons licensed to practice appearance enhancement and the Department of State to increase the number of health and safety inspectors who inspect appearance enhancement businesses.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Amending the general business law to require periodic retraining of persons licensed to practice appearance enhancement and the Dept of State to increase the number of health and safety inspectors who inspect appearance enhancement businesses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to membership of the veterans advisory board, and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation and posting of electronic mail addresses by members of the veterans’ advisory board.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Membership of the veterans advisory board.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Student attrition and backfilling.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health

Items.Title: Application No. 20145332 TCM pursuant to Section 20-225 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition of Eleven Food and Beverage Inc., d/b/a Eleven Food and Beverage, for a revocable consent to establish, maintain and operate an enclosed sidewalk café located at 11 Avenue of the Americas (a/k/a 11 Sixth Avenue), Borough of Manhattan, Community Board 1, Council District 1. This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226(e) of the New York City Administrative Code.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 11 Avenue of the America (aka 11 Sixth Avenue), Manhattan (20145332 TCM)

Items.Title: Application No. 20145332 TCM pursuant to Section 20-225 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition of Eleven Food and Beverage Inc., d/b/a Eleven Food and Beverage, for a revocable consent to establish, maintain and operate an enclosed sidewalk café located at 11 Avenue of the Americas (a/k/a 11 Sixth Avenue), Borough of Manhattan, Community Board 1, Council District 1. This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226(e) of the New York City Administrative Code.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Zoning and Franchises
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 11 Avenue of the America (aka 11 Sixth Avenue), Manhattan (20145332 TCM)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor – Withdrawing M 202 - proposed maritime lease between the New York City Department of Small Business Services and the New York City Economic Development Corporation, for approximately 72 acres of the South Brooklyn Marine Terminal, pursuant to Section 1301(2)(f) of the City Charter.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Withdrawing M 202 - proposed maritime lease between the NYC Dept of Small Business Services and the NYC Economic Development Corporation.

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito), the Public Advocate (Ms. James) adjourned to meet again on Thursday, January 22, 2015.


MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk

Clerk of the Council
There were 49 Council Members marked present at this Charter Meeting.
